title: Teliani Valley 2015 Saperavi (Kakheti)
description: A nose of cherry with a hint of spice leads to flavors of blackberry, cranberry, vanilla and fennel. A sense of brightness on the first sip recedes to showcase silky tannins that last through the pomegranate finish.

title: Saintsbury 2015 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Salty minerality opens this wine and persists on the palate, which remains youthfully firm in the glass. Apricot, preserved lemon and a tart seasoning of oak combine to offer a mix of fruit and savory flavors.

title: Saintsbury 2015 Sangiacomo Green Acres Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Exotic and full-bodied, this wine has richness and a supple texture that lends power and grace. A mineral-laden, stony flavor plays well with the baked apple, pear and fig notes.

title: Secret Spot Wines 2011 Lacrau Garrafeira White (Douro)
description: A single vineyard field blend of old vines has produced a ripe wine that has considerable ginger-spice wood flavors. It has an opulent texture: very smooth and showing complete maturity. The fresh fruit has become honey and dried fruits with almonds and a touch of pepper. Drink the wine now.

title: Lucien Albrecht 2016 Réserve Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: A earthy element creeps into the peach notes on the nose. The medium-sweet palate comes in with refreshing phenolic zestiness. The flavors are full and bright, with just a hint of spice. Drink soon.

title: Magnum Vinhos 2015 Jardim da Estrela Red (Dão)
description: This wine is rich, full of black fruits. It has the typical Dão mineral texture that comes from the granite rocks of the region. A blend of Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Alfrocheiro, it is ripe while remaining balanced and with a crisp edge of acidity. Drink the wine from late 2017.

title: Purcari 2014 1827 Pinot Noir (Moldova)
description: This wine features aromas of red cherry, violet and talcum powder. In the mouth there are flavors of tart cherry and pomegranate juice. It is well balanced, with a pleasantly acidic finish.

title: Quinta das Marias 2015 Lote Red (Dão)
description: This is a solid blend of Touriga Nacional with Tinta Roriz, Jaen and Alfrocheiro—all the Dão grapes in one bottle. The ripe fruit is shot through with minerality and a firm background of tannins and concentration. Drink this balanced wine from 2018.

title: Quinta do Noval 2014 Cedro do Noval Red (Duriense)
description: Because of the Syrah in the blend of this second wine from Noval, it is classified as a regional wine rather than appellation. That bit of bureaucracy to one side, it is fruity with plenty of black fruits and balanced firm tannins. The wine can be drunk now.

title: Pighin 2016 Sauvignon (Collio)
description: Classic varietal aromas of tropical fruit and crushed tomato vine follow through to the refreshing palate along with a grapefruit note. Crisp acidity gives it a bright clean finish.

title: Gamache 2011 Barrel Select Nicolas Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Cabernet Sauvignon (50%) and Merlot (34%) make up the majority of this blend, with the balance equal parts Cabernet Franc and Malbec. Aromas are light and high-toned, with notes of savory herb, cherry and cedar. Elegant in style, the palate is backed by tart acids. The midpalate concentration at times seems a bit wanting, with cranberry flavors lingering on the finish.

title: Gamache 2012 Estate Grown Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Already five years old, this wine still doesn't hasn't opened up, seeming fairly muted aromatically. The flavors are medium bodied, round in the middle and tapering toward the finish.

title: Garces Silva 2015 Boya Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)
description: Leathery cherry aromas lead to a fresh medium-bodied palate. Flavors of spiced plum, cherry and herbal tomato finish with tea notes along with dry spice. Overall, this is balanced and succeeds by keeping things simple.

title: HXM NV Riesling (Landwein Rhein)
description: Deeply savory tones of bramble and earth are juxtaposed against fresh tangerine and lemon in this light-footed, semidry Riesling. It's not a deeply complex wine but sprightly and crisp, with a clean, slightly honeyed finish. Drink now.

title: Gundlach Bundschu 2014 Mountain Cuvée Red (Sonoma County)
description: This hearty blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon with smaller amounts of Malbec and Petit Verdot is a great go-to wine for a crowd. Cabernet leads the way with cedar, cranberry and tobacco notes, clipped by sizable tannin. As it opens, layers of dense raspberry and vanilla flavors unfurl.

title: Kingston Family 2015 Tobiano Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)
description: On first take, this smells a bit green and grassy, while the feel is grabby. Airing and time in the glass help things along, while the flavor profile is a bit salty and oaky, with plum and red-currant notes. A dry earthy peppery-tasting finish closes this out.

title: Koehler 2016 Grenache Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Light in color, this is a very aromatic take on the grape, with powerful jasmine, plumeria and guava aromas as well as just-sliced pear flesh. The palate is also ripe with tropical coconut and guava touches, cut with fresh and zesty acidity.

title: Goodfellow 2014 Whistling Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)
description: Tart and tight, this puts a sharp focus on cranberry and raspberry fruit. There are ample acids and a hint of milk chocolate around light tannins.

title: Gorman 2014 The Albatross Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
description: Barrel aromas are up front on this wine, with notes of char, smoke and coffee bean ahead of herb and cherry. On the palate, the barrel influence also seems to overwhelm the fruit, which doesn't quite have the strength to stand up. Additional time in the bottle might bring it around.

title: Gorman 2015 The F.O.G. Gewürztraminer (Columbia Gorge (WA))
description: This barrel-aged wine brings bright aromas of ginger, spice and lychee. It's rich and full bodied, showing some warmth on the finish.

title: Gotsa Family Wines 2015 Dry Unfiltered Rkatsiteli Mtsvane White (Kartli)
description: Amber to the eye, this wine features an enticing bouquet of almond blossom and toffee. It is slightly chalky on the palate, with a sophisticated mélange of baked apple, peach, smoked meat and pencil-lead flavors. A touch of brightness marks the soft finish.

title: Le Morette 2013 Riserva  (Lugana)
description: Aromas of orchard fruit, chopped herb and a whiff of toasted nut emerge on this medium-bodied white. On the bright palate, bitter almond adds interest to Bartlett pear and lemon zest.

title: Liberty School 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Austin Hope's team puts a lot of love into this widely available bottling that's a steady leader in its price category. Dark in color, it shows clean blackberry, black pepper and dark chocolate aromas. The medium-bodied palate offers dark berry fruit, dried herb and baking spice flavors.

title: Draga 2015 Sauvignon (Collio)
description: Classic varietal aromas of crushed tomato vine, grapefruit and a whiff of aromatic herb take center stage. The grapefruit note carries over to the medium-bodied palate along with honeydew melon and a hint of mineral.

title: Dunham 2015 Shirley Mays Lewis Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Bright aromas of toast, spice and pear are followed by medium-bodied fruit flavors that persist on the finish.

title: Jack 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Small percentages of Cabernet Franc and Merlot add to the mighty mix of this powerful wine, thick with blackberry, wood and leather notes. Youthful, vigorous tannins fill the palate, as well as waves of toasted oak, vanilla and baking spice.

title: Joseph Cattin 2016 Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: Fresh juicy Conference pear dominates nose and palate. The body is light and flavors are off dry, giving an extra boost to the ripe pear notes. The finish has a fresh pithy edge and is moreish. Drink soon while aromas are at their peak.

title: Masut da Rive 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: Aromas of white spring flower, acacia and ripe orchard fruit take center stage while the round medium-bodied palate doles out candied nectarine slices and golden apple.

title: McClean 2015 One Last Syrah (Central Coast)
description: Ripe blueberry and blackberry aromas make for a plush, fruit-driven nose, enhanced by hints of strawberry and milk chocolate. It's soft at first on the palate, then shows tart black plum, thyme and rosemary flavors, making for a bold sip with nice seasonings.

title: Attems 2015 Cicinis Sauvignon (Collio)
description: This has aromas of toast and exotic fruit that carry over to the palate along with notes of citrus zest, vanilla and roasted coffee bean. A hint of grilled herb marks the close.
